org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg
Class HttpReceiverHandshakeMessage

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg.ReceiverHandshakeMessage
      org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg.HttpReceiverHandshakeMessage

public class HttpReceiverHandshakeMessage
extends ReceiverHandshakeMessage

Class used for handshaking. The handshake parameters are internally handled as String. Thus it's evident to validate the values to have correct lengths and contents using the method isValid().

Author:
Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06

init

public void init()
Initialises the ReceiverHandshakeMessage with the required default values. As the default values some conservative values are used (conservative means that for example all format value are set to NO).

Overrides:
init in class ReceiverHandshakeMessage

getHttpContentType

public java.lang.String getHttpContentType()
Gets the Content-Type used in the HTTP header.

Returns:
the MIME type for the message format used in the response.

init

public void init(HttpSenderHandshakeMessage handshake)
Initialises the response handshake using the corresponding values from the request handshake.

Parameters:
handshake - The sender handshake to use for the initialisation of the receiver handshake.
